articles.title: Putin critic Alexei Navalny awarded Europe's top human rights prize - NPR
articles.description: In a clear slap at the Russian leader, the European Union on Wednesday said it was awarding the Sakharov Prize to jailed dissident and Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny.
articles.content: In this March 30, 2017 file photo, Alexei Navalny, right, poses for the press in court in Moscow. The imprisoned Russian opposition leader was awarded the European Union's top human rights prize on W… [+4070 chars]

articles.title: Alcohol causes 'seven of every 100 new breast cancer cases in Europe', WHO warns - The Irish News
articles.description: ALCOHOL consumption causes seven of every 100 new breast cancer cases in Europe every year, the World Health Organisation has said.
articles.content:
ALCOHOL consumption causes seven of every 100 new breast cancer cases in Europe every year, the World Health Organisation has said.
